verses.kjv: And I looked, and, lo, a Lamb stood on the mount Sion, and with him an hundred forty and four thousand, having his Father’s name written in their foreheads.
verses.ct: Then I looked, and there was the Lamb, standing on Mount Zion, and with him were 144,000 people who had his Father's name written on their foreheads.

verses.kjv: And I heard a voice from heaven, as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of a great thunder: and I heard the voice of harpers harping with their harps:
verses.ct: I heard a sound from heaven that was like the roar of rushing waters and like the rumble of powerful thunder. The sound I heard was also like harpists playing their harps.

verses.kjv: And they sung as it were a new song before the throne, and before the four beasts, and the elders: and no man could learn that song but the hundred and forty and four thousand, which were redeemed from the earth.
verses.ct: They were singing what seemed to be a new song in front of the throne, in front of the 4 living creatures, and in front of the elders. No one was able to learn that song except the 144,000 who had been purchased from the earth.

verses.kjv: These are they which were not defiled with women; for they are virgins. These are they which follow the Lamb whithersoever he goeth. These were redeemed from among men, being the firstfruits unto God and to the Lamb.
verses.ct: These are the ones who have not been sexually impure with women — they have kept themselves pure. They follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They were purchased from among humanity as an offering of the first harvest to God and to the Lamb.

verses.kjv: And in their mouth was found no guile: for they are without fault before the throne of God.
verses.ct: No deception was found on their lips, and they are blameless before the throne of God.

verses.kjv: And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people,
verses.ct: Then I saw another angel flying through the middle of heaven, carrying the eternal gospel to proclaim to those living on the earth — to every nation, family, language, and people group.

verses.kjv: Saying with a loud voice, Fear God, and give glory to him; for the hour of his judgment is come: and worship him that made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.
verses.ct: He called out in a loud voice, "Deeply revere God and give him glory, because the time of his judgment has arrived! Worship the one who made heaven, the earth, the sea, and the springs of water."

verses.kjv: And there followed another angel, saying, Babylon is fallen, is fallen, that great city, because she made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.
verses.ct: A second angel followed, declaring, "Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great city! She made every nation drink the wine of her immoral passion and fury."

verses.kjv: And the third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, If any man worship the beast and his image, and receive his mark in his forehead, or in his hand,
verses.ct: Then a 3rd angel followed them, saying in a loud voice, "If anyone worships the beast and its image and accepts its mark on their forehead or on their hand,

verses.kjv: The same shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out without mixture into the cup of his indignation; and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:
verses.ct: that person will also drink the wine of God's fury, poured out at full strength into the cup of his wrath. They will be tormented with fire and sulfur in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the Lamb.

verses.kjv: And the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever: and they have no rest day nor night, who worship the beast and his image, and whosoever receiveth the mark of his name.
verses.ct: The smoke of their torment rises forever and ever. There is no relief day or night for those who worship the beast and its image, or for whoever accepts the mark of its name."

verses.kjv: Here is the patience of the saints: here are they that keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.
verses.ct: This calls for endurance from God's people — those who obey God's commandments and hold firmly to their faith in Jesus.

verses.kjv: And I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Write, Blessed are the dead which die in the Lord from henceforth: Yea, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labours; and their works do follow them.
verses.ct: Then I heard a voice from heaven telling me, "Write this: From now on, those who die belonging to the Lord are blessed." "Yes," says the Spirit, "they will rest from their hard work, and everything they have done follows with them."

verses.kjv: And I looked, and behold a white cloud, and upon the cloud one sat like unto the Son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.
verses.ct: Then I looked, and there was a white cloud, and sitting on the cloud was someone who looked like the Son of Man. He wore a golden crown on his head and held a sharp sickle in his hand.

verses.kjv: And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him that sat on the cloud, Thrust in thy sickle, and reap: for the time is come for thee to reap; for the harvest of the earth is ripe.
verses.ct: Another angel came out of the temple, shouting in a loud voice to the one sitting on the cloud, "Swing your sickle and harvest, because the time to harvest has come — the earth's crop is fully ripe!"

verses.kjv: And he that sat on the cloud thrust in his sickle on the earth; and the earth was reaped.
verses.ct: So the one sitting on the cloud swung his sickle over the earth, and the earth was harvested.

verses.kjv: And another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, he also having a sharp sickle.
verses.ct: Then another angel came out of the temple in heaven, and he also carried a sharp sickle.

verses.kjv: And another angel came out from the altar, which had power over fire; and cried with a loud cry to him that had the sharp sickle, saying, Thrust in thy sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth; for her grapes are fully ripe.
verses.ct: Still another angel, who had authority over fire, came from the altar. He called out loudly to the angel holding the sharp sickle, "Swing your sharp sickle and cut the clusters of grapes from the earth's vine, because its grapes are fully ripe!"

verses.kjv: And the angel thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and cast it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.
verses.ct: So the angel swung his sickle across the earth, gathered the grapes from the earth's vine, and threw them into the great winepress of God's fury.

verses.kjv: And the winepress was trodden without the city, and blood came out of the winepress, even unto the horse bridles, by the space of a thousand and six hundred furlongs.
verses.ct: The winepress was stomped outside the city, and blood flowed out of the winepress, rising as high as a horse's bridle for a distance of about 184 miles.
